name: Crumb-Top Rhubarb Custard Pie
author: Karen
summary: Once rhubarb season starts, my daughter immediately requests I make this pie. The recipe makes a large 10-inch pie, but is very easy to assemble and always comes out perfect.
ingredients: ½ cup firmly packed brown sugar
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Place pie shell into a 10-inch pie plate
Combine eggs, rhubarb, white sugar, milk, cornstarch, nutmeg, and salt in a bowl
Blend flour, brown sugar, and margarine in a bowl using an electric mixer until combined
Sprinkle mixture on top of pie
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes
Remove from oven; reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Return to oven and continue to bake until set and golden brown, about 40 minutes more
